abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Transport
            Infrastructure Investment Project for Madagascar is to
            rehabilitate the country's major transport
            infrastructure in order to reduce transport cost and to
            facilitate trade. The additional activities are unlikely to
            require any change in the project objective. The extension
            of the closing date is being processed as a level two
            restructuring, requiring the Vice President's approval
            since it involves a cumulative extension of the closing date
            of more than two years from the original closing date. This
            extension will allow for: 1) the completion of the suspended
            works contracts as a result of the disbursement freeze due
            to the crisis, in order to reinforce the outcome of our
            investments in railways infrastructure; 2) the payment of
            arrears for works, goods, and services for contracts
            committed after March 17, 2009, and whose corresponding
            services have been duly completed, and 3) the use of the
            remaining funds of SDR2.87 millions, after the payment of
            the two above-mentioned items, to finance transport
            equipment and infrastructure, for unfinished road surface
            layer, slope stabilizations, and some consultancy services.
